Intervention: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a intravenous infusion (IV) once every 3 weeks on day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Eligibility: A non-resectable or metastatic breast cancer documented pathologically with the expression HER2 (immunohistochemistry [IHC] 3+, IHC 2+, IHC 1+ and/or hybridization in situ [ISH] +) which is refractory or intolerable with standard treatment, or for which no standard treatment is available
At a score of 0 or 1 from the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG PS)
Has a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months of registration
Has a medical history of ventricular arrhythmias, other than rare premature ventricular contractions
A cardiovascular disease that is uncontrolled or severe
Results: - QTcF changes after treatment with DS-8201a in participants with metastatic and/or non-resectable breast cancer expressed in HER2
The number of participants whose electrocardiogram has undergone significant changes meeting predefined criteria is indicated.
Time limit: Screening (within 7 days prior to registration) up to cycle 3 Day 15 (each cycle is 21 days)
Description of the arm/group: Participants who received 6.4 mg/kg of DS-8201a intravenous infusion (IV) once every 3 weeks on day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Type of measure: Number of participants
Unit of measure: Participants Maximum change from QTcF reference value: > 30 ms: 3 6.1 per cent
Maximum change from reference value in QTcF: > 60 ms: 0 0.0%
